entry.title: Azerbaijan moves troops, escalating fear of new war in region

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan moves troops, escalating fear of new war in region
media:group.media:description:
üìçKarabakh‚Äôs Defense Ministry released a video appearing to show Azerbaijan moving troops and military equipment around the region, as tensions continue to escalate. üìçArmenian President Vahagn Khachaturyan recalled the country‚Äôs representative to the CSTO, a Russian-led military alliance. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry announced it would host joint military exercises with the United States later this month. üìçAnna Hakobyan, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs wife, spoke at a summit in Kyiv, marking the first visit by a senior Armenian figure to Ukraine since Russia‚Äôs invasion. üìçLocal election monitoring group, Akanates, accused Armenia‚Äôs ruling Civil Contract party of paying young women to take part in campaign events ahead of key city council elections in Yerevan.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: The IMF in Armenia: Relief, Reforms and Russia Sanctions

media:group.media:title: The IMF in Armenia: Relief, Reforms and Russia Sanctions
media:group.media:description:
Jihad Azour, director of the Middle East and Central Asia department at the International Monetary Fund, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about the IMF‚Äôs work in Armenia, including a new stand-by arrangement, which is a short-term financial assistance instrument. They also discuss what the Armenian currency‚Äôs continued strength means for the country and the key issue of compliance with U.S. and European sanctions on Russia.
0:00 What is the IMF doing to support Armenia? 3:00 How can Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank modernize? 4:45 What does a stronger currency mean for Armenia? 7:33 Is Armenia at risk of falling under sanctions? 9:25 What‚Äôs next for the IMF in Armenia?

entry.title: Kremlin fires back at Pashinyan: ‚ÄòRussia cannot leave Armenia‚Äô

media:group.media:title: Kremlin fires back at Pashinyan: ‚ÄòRussia cannot leave Armenia‚Äô
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe International Committee of the Red Cross evacuated nine people in need of medical care from Karabakh to Armenia, according to the region‚Äôs Health Ministry. üìçRussia confirmed the appointment of Major General Kirill Kulakov to head its peacekeepers in Karabakh. He is the peacekeepers‚Äô fifth commander in three years. üìçThe Kremlin insisted it ‚Äúcannot leave Armenia‚Äù after Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan slammed Russia for ‚Äúleaving the region‚Äù and failing to uphold its security commitments.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Karabakh to start rationing bread for first time

media:group.media:title: Karabakh to start rationing bread for first time
media:group.media:description:
üìçStarting tomorrow, Nagorno-Karabakh residents will be able to buy bread only using state-issued ration coupons. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry reported two non-combat army deaths over the weekend. üìçAn airport in Armenia‚Äôs southern Syunik region was struck again by cross-border gunfire from Azerbaijan. There were no injuries. üìçIn a new interview, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan slammed Russia, accusing the country of failing to uphold its security commitments in the region. üìçPashinyan‚Äôs administration formally asked parliament to ratify the Rome Statute, the founding treaty of the International Criminal Court.
